Class Note

java.lang.Object
models.Note
public class Note extends Object
The responsibility of the Note class is to manage a single Note object in the system. Each Note object has the following attributes representing its state:
  • noteTitle The title of the note object, 20 character maximum, defaults to "No Title".
  • notePriority The priority of the note object, integer between 1 and 5, defaults to 1.
  • noteCategory The category of the note object, must be one of "Home", "Work", "Hobby", "Holiday", "College"
  • isNoteArchived => the archived state of the note object, defaults to false.
Additionally, each Note object stores a collection (ArrayList) of Item objects [0 to many], with their respective state(s), defaults to "". Note also accesses CRUD methods in the Item class. Note calls validation methods from the Utilities and CategoryUtility classes.

Purpose:

  • Store and manage a note's attributes.
  • Maintain a collection of Item objects that belong to this note (ArrayList, 0 to many), all Item objects must be linked to a note.
  • Provide CRUD methods to create, list, update, and delete items associated with the note.
  • Enforce validation rules for the Note object's attributes.

  • Constructor Details

    • Note

      public Note(String noteTitle, int notePriority, String noteCategory)
      Constructs a new Note object with specified note title, priority, and category. This constructor enforces validation rules for each field.
      Parameters:
      noteTitle - title of the note (max length 20, defaults to "No Title")
      notePriority - priority of the note (integer between 1 and 5, defaults to 1)
      noteCategory - category of the note (either "Home", "Work", "Hobby", "Holiday", "College"; defaults to "")

  • Method Details

    • getNoteTitle

      public String getNoteTitle()
      Gets the current note's title.
      Returns:
      note's title

    • setNoteTitle

      public void setNoteTitle(String passedNoteTitle)
      Sets the note's title, only if it meets the below validation rules. Calls CategoryUtility to check.
      • Must not exceed 20 characters.
      • If the current title is "No Title" and the new title exceeds 20 characters, truncate.
      • If the current title is valid and the passed note title exceeds 20 characters, do not truncate or update.
      Parameters:
      passedNoteTitle - The title of the note object, 20 character maximum, defaults to "No Title".

    • getNotePriority

      public int getNotePriority()
      Gets the current note's priority.
      Returns:
      note's priority

    • setNotePriority

      public void setNotePriority(int passedNotePriority)
      Sets the current note's priority.
      Parameters:
      passedNotePriority - desired priority of the note object, integer between 1 and 5, defaults to 1.

    • getNoteCategory

      public String getNoteCategory()
      Gets the current note's category.
      Returns:
      note's category

    • setNoteCategory

      public void setNoteCategory(String noteCategory)
      Sets the current note's category. Category validated by methods in CategoryUtility, and must be one of the following:
      • "Home",
      • "Work",
      • "Hobby",
      • "Holiday",
      • "College".
      Defaults to an empty string if no category or an invalid category is provided.
      Parameters:
      noteCategory - the category of the note object, must be one of "Home", "Work", "Hobby", "Holiday", "College"

    • isNoteArchived

      public boolean isNoteArchived()
      Gets the current note's archive state (true if archived, false otherwise).
      Returns:
      note's archive state

    • setNoteArchived

      public void setNoteArchived(boolean noteArchived)
      Sets the current note's archive state
      Parameters:
      noteArchived - the archived state of the note object, defaults to false.

    • getItems

      public ArrayList<Item> getItems()
      Gets the current note's collection of items (ArrayList).
      Returns:
      note's collection of items.

    • setItems

      public void setItems(ArrayList<Item> items)
      Sets the current note's collection of items (ArrayList). Stores a collection (ArrayList) of Item objects [0 to many], with their respective state(s), defaults to ""
      Parameters:
      items - a collection of Item objects [0 to many], defaults to ""

    • numberOfItems

      public int numberOfItems()
      Gets the number of items in the current note's collection.
      Returns:
      number of items in the current note's collection.

    • checkNoteCompletionStatus

      public boolean checkNoteCompletionStatus()
      Checks the completion status for each item on a note. The following logic was copied from assignment spec.
      • If:
        • ALL items are completed or the note has no items, return true.
        • one or more item is TODO, return false.
      Returns:
      true if all items are completed or no note items; false otherwise

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem(Item item)
      Adds an item object to the collection (ArrayList) and returns the boolean result of the add.
      Parameters:
      item - the item object to add to the collection.
      Returns:
      true if the add was successful, false otherwise.

    • listItems

      public String listItems()
      Lists all items associated with the note object in a friendly format. Adds the index number of the item in the collection if there are items. If no items have been added, returns "No items added".
      Returns:
      a String listing all items with their indexes or "No items added"

    • isValidIndex

      public boolean isValidIndex(int index)
      Checks if the passed index is valid in the item's collection items.
      Parameters:
      index - index to check
      Returns:
      true if the index is valid, false otherwise

    • findItem

      public Item findItem(int index)
      Retrieves an Item by its index if valid. Otherwise returns null.
      Parameters:
      index - index of the item to retrieve
      Returns:
      Item at the given index, or null if not found

    • deleteItem

      public Item deleteItem(int index)
      Deletes an Item by its index if valid, and returns that object. Otherwise, returns null.
      Parameters:
      index - index of the item to delete
      Returns:
      deleted Item at the given index, or null if unable to delete

    • updateItem

      public boolean updateItem(int index, String description, boolean isArchived)
      Updates an existing Item at the passed index with a new description and completion status. If the index is invalid, returns false. If the index is valid, updates the Item's description and completion status and returns true.
      Parameters:
      index - index of the item to update
      description - new description
      isArchived - archive status of the item, i.e. true if the item is completed, false otherwise
      Returns:
      true if update was successful, false if not

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      This class was provided in full in the assignment spec. Determines whether the current note is equal to another object. Two notes are equal if they have the same:
      • >title,
      • priority,
      • category,
      • archive status,
      • items.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - object to compare with note
      Returns:
      true if the passed object equals the note, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a user-friendly string representation of the note object, including:
      • note object attributes
      • associated items and item attributes, through calling methods from Item
        • Sample outputs from the assignment spec: 
         Exam Boards, Priority=5, Category=Work, Archived=N
 0: BSc Ord IT, Year 3. [TODO]
 1: BSC Hons in Applied Computing, Year 1. [TODO]
 2: BS Hons in SSD, Year 2. [TODO]
 School Run, Priority=5, Category=Home, Archived=N
 0: Secondary School 3:30. [Completed]
 1: Primary School 2:30. [TODO]|
 Hoover House, Priority=1, Category=Home, Archived=N
 0: Hoover Upstairs. [TODO]
 Polish Furniture, Priority=2, Category=Home, Archived=N
 No items added
 Surf, Priority=4, Category=Hobby, Archived=Y
 No items added
 Book Holiday, Priority=5, Category=Home, Archived=N
 0: Book flights. [Completed]
 1: Book hotel. [Completed]
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string representation of the note and its items
